page.title: 09Landscape and buildings
page.content:
The upper ground above the woods was forested until the mid 19th century, so most of the farms there are relatively recent. Many of these buildings have their date of construction highlighted in contrasting bricks on their walls. It is noticeable that the roads and field boundaries in this part of the area are very straight.
In the centre of the village there is a spring known as The Fountain which bears the inscription:{ { WHILE COOLER WATERS HERE YE DRINK { REST NOT YOUR THOUGHTS BELOW { LOOK TO THE SACRED SIGN AND THINK { WHENCE LIVING WATERS FLOW More recently a new sign has been posted by the medical officer for Uttoxeter Rural District Council: { THIS WATER IS UNFIT FOR DRINKING
